results.title: Infectious diseases and natural body defenses
results.brief_description: Uses photomicrography, laboratory demonstration, and animation to illustrate the two groups of natural body defences which guard the body against disease. Explains the outer body defences including the skin, passages of the nose and throat, and stomach acids. Among the inner body defences are lymph glands, the chemical antibodies, spleen, liver and while blood cells.

results.title: Infectious diseases and man-made defences
results.brief_description: Some of the causes of infectious diseases and how we use man-made defences to protect ourselves. How antitoxins, vaccines, antibiotics and synthetic drugs are produced and used to help active and passive immunity in the body.

results.title: Infected
results.material_description: video, circular screen, projection, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Infected is a projected video installation about the nature of the physical body in the context of future technological possibilities, seen through dance and digitally manipulated imagery. The new bio-engineered body is still a sexual, stark, brutal, organic, pounding bloody system with ripping tendons. It is beautiful and repulsive, indulgent, curious, emotional, un/controlled, breeding, changing.

Gina Czarnecki is an artist originating from the UK whose films and installations have been exhibited widely across the UK and around the world. Infected continues her work around the visceral, biological and emotive body and its politics in relation to new technologies.

This video is made in collaboration with Iona Kewney, a Glasgow-based dance artist. It features a specially commissioned score by Fennesz, whose computer-manipulations of sounds derived from guitar and other acoustic sources have won him worldwide acclaim as one of the most innovative and important artists working in electronic music.

results.title: Infant development in the kibbutz (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines infant behaviour under the kibbutz system of shared parental and group care. Shows activities of the “baby house” where babies ranging from newborn to 21 months old are cared for while their parents are at work.

results.title: Infant dance (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Wolverhampton Education Committee
results.brief_description: A class of 6-7 year olds is observed performing spontaneous dance movements, movements inspired by suggestions from the teacher, and by short rhythms played on percussion instruments. Individual children are studied in closer detail.

results.title: Infant cognition (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
An exploration of the development of the bond between mother and her baby. Using special filming technique it analyses sequences of what is known as per-speech, a recently discovered phenomenon where babies, even of a few days old, take part in adult-type conversations with their mothers.

results.title: Infancy (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Howard Gardner, Jerome Kagan, Harper & Row and Bay State Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines behaviour and cognitive patterns characteristic of the first 18 months of life, including object permanence, stranger and separation anxiety, reaction to discrepancy and maturing co-ordinations. Discusses individual differences in infant temperament.
